name: The Clover
image: A small, bright green four-leaf clover growing in a sunlit patch. Simple, unassuming, lucky. The kind of thing you'd miss if you weren't looking down at the right moment.
as_person: A lucky person, a gambler, someone carefree and lighthearted. A person who stumbles into good fortune. The friend who always finds a parking spot. Someone who doesn't take life too seriously.

modifier_behavior.as_modifier: Adds luck, lightness, or a small blessing to the card it touches. Softens negative cards slightly—not a cure, but a silver lining. Makes positive cards luckier.
modifier_behavior.as_modified: The card's core meaning becomes fortunate, eased, or serendipitous. What was difficult gets a lucky break; what was good gets a bonus. The effect is real but brief.

topic_contexts.love: A lucky encounter, a chance meeting with romantic potential. A small flirtation, a happy coincidence in love. Light, playful romantic energy—not the great love, but the delightful spark.
topic_contexts.career: A small professional opportunity, a lucky break at work, being in the right place at the right time. A quick win, a favorable gamble. Don't overthink it—grab it.
topic_contexts.health: Quick recovery, a small health improvement, good news from a test. A lucky health outcome. The body bouncing back faster than expected.
topic_contexts.finances: A small financial windfall, a lucky bet, finding money or a deal. Quick gains rather than long-term wealth. A pleasant financial surprise.
topic_contexts.spiritual: Synchronicities, small signs from the universe, lucky coincidences that feel guided. The spiritual equivalent of finding a four-leaf clover—a wink from something larger.

line_reading.as_first: The situation opens with a stroke of luck or a small opportunity. Something fortunate sets the stage—but it may be fleeting, so pay attention.
line_reading.as_middle: Luck enters the picture. A fortunate turn, a small blessing, or a moment of levity shifts the energy. The middle of the story gets a break.
line_reading.as_last: The outcome is fortunate, if modest. A small blessing, a lucky break, a positive resolution. Not a grand triumph—but a genuine, sweet win.

combination_grammar.description: Fallback rules for combinations not explicitly listed. Use these to synthesize meaning when a specific pairing isn't in the combinations array.
combination_grammar.as_card_a: When The Clover appears BEFORE (left of) another card, it blesses Card B with luck or ease. Whatever Card B represents arrives fortunately, smoothly, or with serendipity. Think: 'lucky [Card B]' or '[Card B] with ease.'
combination_grammar.as_card_b: When The Clover appears AFTER (right of) another card, Card A's energy leads to a small blessing or lucky outcome. Think: '[Card A] brings good fortune' or '[Card A] ends well.' Card A lands on a four-leaf clover.
combination_grammar.with_positive_card: Double luck, amplified blessings, fortune on fortune. The good thing becomes even better. A charmed outcome.
combination_grammar.with_negative_card: The sting is softened, the blow is cushioned, a silver lining appears. Not a rescue—but the worst case becomes less worst. Lucky escape.
combination_grammar.with_person_card: That person is lucky, lighthearted, or brings a small blessing. They're the fortunate element in the situation. Lucky connection.
combination_grammar.with_object_card: That thing or concept is touched by luck, arrives fortunately, or has a serendipitous quality. It's the fortunate detail in the picture.

combinations.as_first: Lucky news, a fortunate message arrives, a visitor bringing small blessings. Good news comes quickly.
combinations.as_second: News brings luck, a message creates opportunity, a visitor triggers a fortunate turn.

combinations.as_first: Lucky journey, fortunate travel, commerce brings quick gains. A trip goes smoothly and brings small blessings.
combinations.as_second: Luck comes from afar, opportunity through travel, fortunate distance. Good fortune arrives from foreign quarters.

combinations.as_first: Lucky home, fortunate domestic situation, a blessing for family or property. The house is charmed.
combinations.as_second: Home brings luck, domestic stability creates opportunity, family life delivers a small fortune.

combinations.as_first: Luck runs out, a small blessing ends, the window of fortune closes. Fleeting luck that's already passed.
combinations.as_second: An ending brings unexpected relief, closure is luckier than expected, the death of something opens a fortunate door.

combinations.as_first: Luck with complications, a fortunate opportunity that comes with strings. The four-leaf clover has a snake underneath.
combinations.as_second: A complication leads to an unexpected blessing, deception accidentally creates opportunity. Twisted luck.

combinations.as_first: Luck being eroded, a small blessing diminished by worry, fortune nibbled away. The clover is wilting.
combinations.as_second: Anxiety stumbles into fortune, worry accidentally leads somewhere lucky, loss creates unexpected gain.

combinations.as_first: A small blessing in suffering, luck within burden, a fortunate aspect to a difficult fate. The silver lining.
combinations.as_second: A burden leads to unexpected luck, suffering opens a fortunate door, destiny delivers a small grace.

combinations.as_first: Lucky in love, a fortunate romantic encounter, a small blessing in matters of the heart. Serendipitous romance.
combinations.as_second: Love leads to luck, following the heart pays off, an emotional risk is rewarded. The heart finds its clover.

combinations.as_first: Exceptional luck, fortune amplified, a truly blessed outcome. The luckiest combination—grab whatever this touches.
combinations.as_second: Success brings more luck, joy creates fortunate circumstances, happiness compounds. The sun shines on the clover.

combinations.as_first: Financial luck, a lucky investment, a small windfall that leads to abundance. Money falls into your lap.
combinations.as_second: Money brings a lucky opportunity, finances open a fortunate door, abundance leads to more abundance.

combinations.as_first: Lucky breakthrough, a fortunate solution, serendipity unlocks something important. The answer finds you.
combinations.as_second: A solution brings luck, unlocking something leads to good fortune, the key fits on the first try.

combinations.as_first: A lucky choice, the fortunate path, one option is clearly luckier than the other. Trust your gut—it's charmed.
combinations.as_second: A decision leads to luck, choosing creates fortune, the fork in the road has a four-leaf clover on one side.

combinations.as_first: Luck within institutions, a fortunate official outcome, a bureaucratic win. Lucky with authority.
combinations.as_second: An institution creates a lucky break, official channels deliver an unexpected blessing, authority works in your favor.

combinations.as_first: A lucky man, a man who brings good fortune, a fortunate encounter with a man. He's in the right place at the right time.
combinations.as_second: A man leads to luck, a man creates a fortunate opportunity, a man is your four-leaf clover.

combinations.as_first: A lucky woman, a woman who brings good fortune, a fortunate encounter with a woman. She's your stroke of luck.
combinations.as_second: A woman leads to luck, a woman creates a fortunate opportunity, a woman is your good omen.

combinations.as_first: A lucky new beginning, a fortunate fresh start, a small blessing for something young or new. Beginner's luck.
combinations.as_second: A new start brings luck, a child brings joy and fortune, innocence leads to serendipity. Happy little accident.

grand_tableau.as_house: The House of Luck — Cards landing here speak to where fortune, serendipity, or small blessings are operating in the querent's life. This house asks: where is the luck? What's the fortunate break?
grand_tableau.near_significator: Luck is close. The querent is in a fortunate period—small blessings are available, opportunities are nearby. Grab them; they're fleeting.
grand_tableau.far_from_significator: Luck is distant or not yet in play. Fortune isn't the main story right now. The four-leaf clover is in someone else's yard—for the moment.
grand_tableau.diagonal_or_corner: Luck operates as background energy—not the headline, but quietly improving odds. Small fortunate coincidences may go unnoticed unless the querent pays attention.
